aws::graph::propositions: # Hughes 369 D Helicopter Accident Information
The accident involved a cabin safety event during cruise flight with engine(s) operating.
The pilot was a 47-year-old male.
The pilot held a Commercial certificate.
The pilot had no Airplane Rating(s).
The pilot had Helicopter Rating(s).
The pilot had Instrument Rating(s) for Helicopter.
The pilot had no Instructor Rating(s).
The pilot occupied the left seat.
No second pilot was present during the accident.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 2 Medical Certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA Medical Exam was on April 24, 2012.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last Flight Review or Equivalent was on June 7, 2012.
The pilot had 11,796 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 500 total flight hours in this make and model.
The pilot had 8,159 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 94 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 14 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The aircraft was a Hughes 369 D helicopter.
The aircraft registration was N818CE.
The aircraft serial number was 610983D.
The aircraft had a Normal Airworthiness Certificate.
The aircraft was not amateur built.
The aircraft had skid landing gear.
The aircraft had 4 seats.
The aircraft's last inspection was on May 16, 2012, type AAIP.
The aircraft had 92 hours since the last inspection.
The aircraft's maximum certified gross weight was 3000 pounds.
The aircraft had 11,784 total airframe hours at the time of the accident.
The aircraft had 1 turbo shaft engine.
The engine was manufactured by ALLISON.
The engine model was 250 C20R/2.
The engine was rated at 450 Horsepower.
The aircraft had an Emergency Locator Transmitter (ELT) installed but not activated.
Southern California Edison Co. was the registered owner of the aircraft.
Southern California Edison Co. was the operator of the aircraft.
The operator held no operating certificates.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
Standing-engine(s) operating | Cabin safety event (Defining event)
Enroute-cruise | Cabin safety event

## Pilot Information
Certificate: | Commercial
Age: | 47,Male
Airplane Rating(s): | None
Seat Occupied: | Left
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Helicopter
Restraint Used:
Instrument Rating(s): | Helicopter
Second Pilot Present: | No
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 2 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | April 24, 2012
Occupational Pilot: | Yes
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | June 7, 2012
Flight Time: | 11796 hours (Total, all aircraft), 500 hours (Total, this make and model), 8159 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 94 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 14 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft)

## Aircraft and Owner/Operator Information
Aircraft Make: | Hughes
Registration: | N818CE
Model/Series: | 369 D
Aircraft Category: | Helicopter
Year of Manufacture: | Amateur Built:
Airworthiness Certificate: | Normal
Serial Number: | 610983D
Landing Gear Type: | Skid
Seats: | 4
Date/Type of Last Inspection: | May 16, 2012 AAIP
Certified Max Gross Wt.: | 3000 lbs
Time Since Last Inspection: | 92 Hrs
Engines: | 1 Turbo shaft
Airframe Total Time: | 11784 Hrs at time of accident
Engine Manufacturer: | ALLISON
ELT: | Installed, not activated
Engine Model/Series: | 250 C20R/2
Registered Owner: | Southern California Edison Co.
Rated Power: | 450 Horsepower
Operator: | Southern California Edison Co.
Operating Certificate(s) Held: | None
